name: Pasta Primavera with Lemon-Caper Sauce
author: Crosse & Blackwell
summary: Colorful, crisp-tender veggies are tossed with linguine pasta and a creamy lemon-caper sauce and served with shredded Parmesan cheese.
ingredients: ¼ cup Crisco® Pure Olive Oil
1 large red or yellow onion, chopped
1 pound fresh asparagus spears, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 medium yellow squash or zucchini, quartered lengthwise, sliced 1/4-inch thick
8 ounces cooked linguine pasta, kept warm
2 tablespoons Pillsbury BEST® All Purpose Flour
3 tablespoons Santa Cruz Organic® Pure Lemon Juice
¼ cup Crosse & Blackwell® Capers, drained
directions: Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat
Cook over medium-low heat 7 minutes or until soft
Add asparagus, yellow squash, salt and pepper
Cook an additional 5 minutes or until crisp-tender
Heat butter in medium saucepan over medium heat
Stir in flour and garlic until blended
Gradually stir in chicken broth until smooth
Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring constantly
Reduce heat to low; simmer 5 minutes
Stir in lemon juice and capers
Combine pasta, vegetable and sauce mixtures in pasta pot
